citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility does not have an attending veterinarian and approved Program of Veterinary Care for the regulated animals in
the facility. The facility first informed USDA inspectors via text communication on August 30, 2024, that their attending
veterinarian was no longer going to provide services to their facility. The previous attending veterinarian shared with the
inspectors the letter communicating his cancelation of services with the facility on August 30, 2024. To this date, the
facility has not made formal arrangements with a new attending veterinarian and have an approved Program of Veterinary
Care.
Having an attending veterinarian and a written Program of Veterinary Care, along with regularly scheduled visits to the
premises, is important for maintaining animal health and welfare. The licensee must have an attending veterinarian (AV)
to provide adequate veterinary care to the animals. Each exhibitor shall employ an attending veterinarian under a formal
arrangement. The facility must have a formal arrangement with a veterinarian that can provide and maintain an adequate
Program of Veterinary Care.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
REBECCA NANNEY, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
